q: Union speech. Democratic Sen. Bernie Sanders Patrick Leahy sat in a bipartisan group with Republicans from Alabama, Kansas, and Wyoming. He said the president sounded less like a professor and more like a statesman. Governing and budgeting are about choices and priorities, and I agree with the president that our budget focus needs to be on what makes America stronger, Patrick Leahy said in a written statement. Sen. Bernie Sanders praised the president's take on a wide range of issues that the Independent routinely fights for.`` The president covered a lot of territory tonight but

In deciding who should take the business forward, we wanted someone with the right mix of leadership, vision and hard-core engineering chops, Steve Ballmer wrote in a Feb. 9 e-mail to employees.`` We wanted someone who could define the future of business computing and further expand our ability to bring the cloud to business customers and developers in game-changing ways.

What I do think Facebook has shown Google Inc. is that they're moving too slow, Lou Kerner said.`` Facebook is moving at the speed of light and Google Inc. isn't.`` Having three people running the company, making the decisions, was slowing it down,'' he added.

.`` We were just thrilled to be by her side,'' Debbie Wasserman Schultz recalled of her visit to the hospital Wednesday night, along with House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi and New York Barack Obama Kirsten Gillibrand . And we were prepared to do and say anything- if she could hear us- to provide comfort and encouragement. Gabrielle Giffords lay in her hospital bed with her eyes closed, swathed in bandages. With her was her husband, Mark Kelly. The three women gathered around her, Debbie Wasserman Schultz recalled in an interview.

know, there's a lot of talk these days around here about where members of Congress are going to sit during the State of the Union address,'' Indiana Republican Mike Pence said recently on the House floor. Well, I've been in Congress for 10 years and I learned a long time ago, it doesn't really matter where you sit- it matters where you stand.
